greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Size of the span of the unlabeled rooted tree with Matula-Goebel number n.
comment: The span of a tree is defined to be the set of possible terminal subtrees of initial subtrees, or, which is the same, the set of possible initial subtrees of terminal subtrees.
example: 42 is the Matula-Goebel number of (o(o)(oo)), which has span {o, (o), (oo), (ooo), (oo(oo)), (o(o)o), (o(o)(oo))}, so a(42) = 7.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 13 2018
